intro: Cryptantha clevelandii var. clevelandii, commonly known as Cleveland's cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and typically grows in dry, rocky soils. The plant produces small, blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, and it is adapted to arid environments. It is often found in coastal sage scrub and chaparral habitats.
